intro: Cojoba standleyi, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic and practical properties.
